page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: THERE ARE VERY FEW CHILDREN IN THIS AREA AND THE LOCAL COMMUNITY IS VERY BITTER ABOUT THE CLOSURE OF THE SCHOOL AT FILGRAVE IN 1984.ALL CHILDREN FROM GAYHURST,TYRINGHAM AND FILGRAVE USED TO GO THERE FROM 5 TO 8.THERE ARE ONLY 11 CHILDREN IN THIS AGE RANGE. MIDDLE SCHOOL EDUCATION:FOR FILGRAVE CHILDREN OLNEY BUT FOR GAYHURST CEDARS MIDDLE,NEWPORT PAGNELL.AT 12 THEY ALL GO TO THE OUSEDALE SCHOOL,NEWPORT PAGNELL, A MIXED COMPREHENSIVE WITH APPROX.1600 STUDENTS.A CONSTANT FEATURE OF LIFE IS THE NEED FOR TRANS- PORT OUT OF THE VILLAGES,FOR EDUCATION COACHES HIRED FROM SOULS OF OLNEY OR WESLEYS OF STOKE GOLDINGTON. THERE IS NO NURSERY CLASS OR PLAYGROUP BUT SOME GO TO A PLAYGROUP IN OLNEY (1-3p.m.),STOKE GOLDINGTON OR SHERING- TON.MANY CHILDREN GO TO PRIVATE SCHOOLS EITHER AS DAY PUPILS OF BOARDERS.
